And who will rescue us from the dictator who is ruling this country???

And who will rescue us from the dictator who is ruling this country???

 
 In case you didn't notice, America is a democracy and George W. Bush was elected by the American people to be their president (Though, some might argue otherwise with the Florida recount ordeal). I imagine your rescuer is Howard Dean, but I don't want to seem presumptuous. I would recommend studying American government before calling the President of the United States of America a dictator... I do not want to be throwing out facetious rhetoric, but I would think twice before making such incongruent statements.

And who will rescue us from the dictator who is ruling this country???

 
 Please supply your evidence for your conclusion.
 
 Currently, people feel safer, no terrorist attacks on this soil since 2001, taxes are down, productivity is up, the economy is moving into recovery and expansion (as opposed to the recession that began in the previous administration), Saddam Hussein has been captured, the republic is strong, medicare has a new prescription benefit, The AIDS battle has been taken to the African continent etc.
 
 All in all, things look good.

.
 
 Currently, people feel safer, no terrorist attacks on this soil since 2001, taxes are down, productivity is up, the economy is moving into recovery and expansion (as opposed to the recession that began in the previous administration), Saddam Hussein has been captured, the republic is strong, medicare has a new prescription benefit, The AIDS battle has been taken to the African continent etc.
 
 All in all, things look good.

 
 I never felt unsafe, actually, and to my friends who survived nazi europe, a lot of these things that have been done to "protect us" have resembled the nazi's..."papers please"
 As for the economy... it can't be looking that good when unemployment is at record highs... people haven't had to look so hard or so long for work. Here in Denver it is especially evident, with several industries laying off by the hundreds and thousands. During the last administration we were rated as having the best job market and the fastest growin economy in the nation, now we are struggling to simply pay the bills.
 I couldn't care less about Saddam Hussein and in fact have definite worries about his treatment and inevitable trial, when our own president is calling for his execution.
 Medicare has a new prescription benefit, sure... but medical funding has been cut to all programs offering reproductive health (including contraceptives) to other nations as well as our own. Hard to prevent the spread of aids without giving them condoms!
 
 There are lots of other bad results of his administration... but I won't get into them right now. My biggest qualm about his admin. is it's dynastic qualities- his choice of cabinet and other appointees... C'mon- Kissinger?
 
 all in all, things look very bad.
 
 I wouldn't go so far as to call him a dictator, though.... just wish to heck I didn't have to call him president.

 As for the economy, it started going south in the last six months of the clinton administration. It got worse with 9/11 which may not have happened had clinton accepted the offer of Osama Bin Laden at the time he was offered. Additionally we just hit a productivity high for the economy;
 
 
 GDP Surged in Q3, Government Confirms 
 
 Tuesday, December 23, 2003
 
 WASHINGTON - The U.S. economy, propelled by tax cuts and low interest rates, roared ahead at an 8.2 percent annual rate in the third quarter, the best showing in nearly 20 years, while Americans' incomes and spending both showed healthy gains in November.
 http://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,106482,00.html
 
 As for security measures, I think the jury is still out on that. I have produced my ID when travelling, which is reasonable. The difference is that Nazi Germany used that to keep people in country not out.

First of all, unemployment isn't at record highs. Unemployment is 5.9%... that is no where near a record. Corporate profits are at record highs. Guess what that means? They fired too many people. So now they're going to rehire. In EVERY major recovery it has taken MONTHS to actually start gaining jobs. And I mean in every one... go look at the charts, it's a clear trend. We've already gained 328,000 in the past three months, more are on the way.
 
 Kissinger isn't a member of the Bush government. :-\
